medical_history.chief_complaint: Diagnosis of a SDHD gene mutation and incidental findings of an adrenal tumor and HNPGL.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was referred for clinical follow-up at age 40 due to a previously identified SDHD mutation. Seven years later, he was diagnosed with nephrolithiasis, and CT revealed an adrenal tumor. At age 46, MRI showed an HNPGL, and follow-up imaging after surgery revealed stable thoracic lesions for 3 years before an acute radicular syndrome led to the discovery of multiple bone metastases.
